title: Liverpool transfer news and rumours: Reds to make shock swoop for Middlesbrough star Gaston Ramirez?
text:

Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp is interested in taking Middlesbrough's Gaston Ramirez to Anfield. 
That is according to The Sun, who say the wantaway Uruguayan is on the Reds' radar after a potential move to Leicester didn't come to fruition in January. 
Ramirez handed in a transfer request on Teesside but Boro stood their ground to retain the services of the attacking midfielder. 
But boss Aitor Karanka's hand may be forced in the summer if a substantial offer comes in for Ramirez. Reds to change keepers again Karius is set to replace Mignolet once more (Photo: AMA/Getty) 
Simon Mignolet is set to be axed again by Liverpool boss Jurgen Klopp. 
Goalkeeper Mignolet, who was singled out for criticism by manager Klopp last weekend, will be a victim as the German gets tough with his out-of-form Reds, writes Mirror Football's David Maddock. 
Loris Karius is likely to be recalled in place of Mignolet, while Klopp looks certain to bring back Giorginio Wijnaldum in midfield and Divock Origi may also get a starting opportunity up front. 
Mignolet's potential summer sale could finance a move for England No1 Joe Hart, although Liverpool have not so far considered the Manchester City star spending the season on loan at Torino as a target. Lallana facing race against time Lallana didn't train on Thursday (Photo: Andrew Powell) 
Neither Adam Lallana or Dejan Lovren appeared to take part in Liverpool training at Melwood ahead of Saturday’s huge game against fellow top four contenders Tottenham. 
Lallana was reportedly omitted as a precaution, having experienced a tight muscle, though the club hope he will respond well to treatment to recover in time for the Anfield clash, writes the Liverpool Echo's James Pearce. 
Croatian defender Lovren was absent from last weekend’s 2-0 defeat to Hull City due to a swollen knee, but a Friday return to training should also mean he features on Saturday. 
There was more concern for Jurgen Klopp as centre-back Ragnar Klavan worked away from the main group with the rehab staff following a bout of illness. Like us on Facebook
